history.content:
Apologies for the duplicate and mass postings, but we must reach all CS 162 students before Wednesday's lecture.

CS 162 students - please read the entire message as it contains important information for tomorrow’s class

 

Welcome to CS 162! We have a very exciting and interesting semester planned for you.

 

Due to record demand this spring, we had a very long wait list of majors who wanted to take CS 162. To address the demand, we petitioned College of Engineering Dean Sastry to permit us to over enroll the course beyond 245 Li Ka Shing’s capacity. Dean Sastry granted our request, enabling us to increase the course size from 300 to 400.

 

In approving our request, the Dean required that Jonathan and I agreed to fulfill the department’s responsibilities as follows:

  • To enforce fire code, up to refusing to continue with lecture should that become necessary.

  • To webcast the lecture so in the unexpected event that the room is overcrowded and students are turned away, they will still have access to all course content.

  • To communicate very prominently in any printed and online materials that if the lecture hall reaches capacity at any time, students will be turned away and directed to the webcast.  

  • The link for this will be provided to ensure that students don’t miss part of the class searching for the webcast version.

  • To ensure that special provision is afforded to accommodate the needs of any disabled students for whom watching the lecture online would adversely affect their learning outcomes compared to attending the lecture in person.

 

What this means is the following:

  • Once 245 Li Ka Shing reaches capacity (every seat is taken), we will not be able to allow anyone else into the room. If there are people in the room without seats (i.e., standing or sitting in aisles), we will have to stop the lecture until they leave, so please don’t do this.

  • We are webcasting the course (slide and audio capture) and videos will be posted on CalCentral: https://calcentral.berkeley.edu/academics/semester/spring-2018 (select COMPSCI 162).

  • This notice is being provided to all students via email, Piazza (162 and EECS), and postings outside the classroom.

  • Lectures slides will be posted in advance of lecture. Webcasts will not be live, but will be posted by ETS within 48 hours of the end of class.

  • Students with disabilities should make sure their accommodation letters are available to us from the DSP office so that we can ensure that they are accommodated with an in-class seat. Also, please arrive early so that we do not have to ask another student to leave.

 

Thank you for your understanding,

 

Anthony and Jonathan
history.subject: [CS 162] Please read if you are in CS 162
